'They created us': UCF alumni ready opening of university-inspired restaurant | News | The Charge Skip to main content You are the owner of this article. Edit Article Add New Article Close You have permission to edit this article. Edit Close Sign Up Log In Dashboard Logout My Account Dashboard Profile Saved items Logout Home About Us Contact Us News Academics Administration Business Dining and Housing Politics Safety Science and Health Student Government Sports Football Basketball Baseball Softball Soccer Volleyball Other Sports Club Sports Administration Life Arts Books Food and Drink Greek Life Music Theater TV and Movies Local Events Student Organizations Multimedia Charge On Air Newscasts Webcasts Podcasts Charge Latino News Sports Webcasts Podcasts Newscasts Centric In-Depth Web Exclusives Best of Centric Archives About The Charge News The Charge On-Air The Charge Latino Centric Contact Us Site search Search Toggle navigation Sign Up Log In Dashboard Logout My Account Dashboard Profile Saved items Logout Home About Us Contact Us News Academics Administration Business Dining and Housing Politics Safety Science and Health Student Government Sports Football Basketball Baseball Softball Soccer Volleyball Other Sports Club Sports Administration Life Arts Books Food and Drink Greek Life Music Theater TV and Movies Local Events Student Organizations Multimedia Charge On Air Newscasts Webcasts Podcasts Charge Latino News Sports Webcasts Podcasts Newscasts Centric In-Depth Web Exclusives Best of Centric Archives About The Charge News The Charge On-Air The Charge Latino Centric Contact Us Close 'They created us': UCF alumni ready opening of university-inspired restaurant Gaby Vargas Nov 23, 2021 Nov 23, 2021 Updated Nov 24, 2021 0 Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Bounce House sits on Challenger Parkway on Nov. 6. UCF alumnus Michael D'Esposito co-founded the new restaurant and bar with two other UCF alumni. "We came, we saw it and our imagination started running wild," he said of the venue for Bounce House, which previously housed a barbeque restaurant. Gaby Vargas A group of UCF alumni are preparing to open a new restaurant and bar down the road, inspired by the culture of the university they came from. Alumni Michael D’Esposito, Chase Tate and Anthony Zanette are the co-founders of Bounce House, which is set open in early January. D'Esposito said their initial efforts to open the restaurant were pushed back due to the coronavirus pandemic. "COVID put us through a run,” D’Esposito said. “We probably should’ve been open a year ago.” Despite the difficulties they've faced, the restaurant was able to open Nov. 5 for a one-time, alumni-only event. Although the owners encouraged people to come and visit the restaurant, they emphasized this event did not serve as a grand opening. “We don’t want people to think that just 'cause this is going on tonight, we’re open tomorrow,” D’Esposito said. D’Esposito said it was important to them to make this alumni event work, especially being friends with one of the event heads, fellow alum Emily Smith. Smith, assistant director of the UCF Foundation's Young Alumni Engagement and Philanthropy, attended UCF around the same time as D’Esposito. Smith said the alumni council is always looking for alumni-owned businesses to partner with for the annual Black and Gold Takeover, an event designed to engage local alumni, as well as “welcome home” returning alumni. A sign for the Bounce House restaurant and bar sits on the building's storefront on Nov. 6. Although slated to officially open in early January, the restaurant's original grand opening plans were delayed by the coronavirus pandemic, D'Esposito said. "COVID put us through a run,” he said. “We probably should’ve been open a year ago.” Gaby Vargas “The appeal of a brand-new venue that was not yet open to the public gave our alumni an exclusive look and created a great energy around the event,” Smith said. D’Esposito said opening the restaurant is a project he, Tate and Zanette have wanted to do; it was just a matter of finding the right place to do it. The trio had been looking for venues around the UCF area for a couple years, so when the previous owner of the building informed them he was selling his establishment, it seemed like the right fit. The co-founders said that not only was it a venue with proximity to the university, it also felt like home to them. The location used to be home to a different restaurant, Bubbalou’s Bodacious BBQ. “I used to come and eat here with (D'Esposito's) older brother,” Tate said. Tate said he and his fellow co-founders didn't feel there were any good establishments around that would cater to alumni, which inspired them to open this new restaurant down the road from UCF on Challenger Parkway. Nonetheless, the owners don’t want to discourage younger or current students from enjoying the experience. Tate said Bounce House is also a place for younger people to go when they don't want to go downtown. However, this isn’t just another typical college bar. D'Esposito said Bounce House will be a "full-service restaurant." “We definitely want to cater toward also the faculty and staff of UCF, make sure they enjoy the cuisine and the atmosphere as well,” Tate said. Tate said their goal is to provide a place for people who want to enjoy a good meal while they watch games and just have a good time. “We’re excited as alumni to finally show what some UCF culture looks like,” Tate said. “This is the culture they created … They created this: They created us.” Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save × Post a comment as anonymous Emoticons [smile] [beam] [wink] [sad] [cool] [innocent] [rolleyes] [whistling] [lol] [huh] [tongue] [love] [sleeping] [yawn] [unsure] [angry] [blink] [crying] [ohmy] [scared] [sleep] [sneaky] [tongue_smile] [thumbdown] [thumbup] [censored] [happybirthday] [ban] [spam] [offtopic] [batman] [ninja] [pirate] [alien] Comment Text Cancel Post comment × Report Cancel Report Abuse × Watch this discussion. Frequently Asked Questions - BOUNCE Inc Australia | Indoor Action Adventure Park Skip to content Login Search Main Menu About Freestyle BOUNCE Rewards Frequently Asked Questions Contact Us Hosts Features Parties Ultimate Parties miniBOUNCE Parties Unhosted Parties Get Ready For Your Party Groups Group Events School Sessions Full Venue Hire Tickets & Prices Prices Offers & Promotions End of Term Party Gift Vouchers & Multi Visit Passes Classes & Memberships BOUNCE Memberships miniBOUNCE Squad Memberships How To Book Memberships BOUNCE Freestyle Academy miniBOUNCE Squad BOUNCE  Squad Flight Squad Ninja Squad Holiday Camp Careers Locations Australian Capital Territory Belconnen Victoria Blackburn Essendon Fields Geelong Glen Iris Heidelberg Keysborough Wodonga Western Australia Cannington Joondalup Osborne Park New South Wales Cromer Homebush Queensland Gold Coast Macgregor miniBOUNCE Carindale miniBOUNCE Ipswich Morayfield Tingalpa South Australia Greenacres Marleston Tasmania Hobart Edit Booking Book Now Frequently Asked Questions Find the answer to your BOUNCE questions below! Can I Book With Afterpay? Which BOUNCE venues can I book with Afterpay? We offer Afterpay as a payment method at all BOUNCE and miniBOUNCE venues in Australia. What BOUNCE products can I book with Afterpay? BOUNCE general session tickets, After Dark or parties can be paid online with Afterpay. We do not accept Afterpay on BOUNCE Freestyle Academy, or schools and group bookings made over the phone. When can I use Afterpay at BOUNCE? Afterpay is available for online or in-venue bookings where the booking is for general session tickets, After Dark or Parties. Afterpay is not available for bookings made over the phone with our Contact Centre. Is there a maximum or minimum spend? BOUNCE accepts payments up to $2,000 on Afterpay. There is no minimum amount required. I am booking a Party, can I pay with Afterpay? Yes, you can use Afterpay when you book your BOUNCE party online at bounceinc.com.au. Please note that your first Afterpay order reflects the $150 party deposit. If you wish to pay the remaining balance of your party on Afterpay, please do so online when you receive your payment reminder email. Otherwise card payments, Google and Apple Pay are available for the remaining balance if you do not wish to use Afterpay. I am booking a general session, can I pay with Afterpay? Yes, you can use Afterpay when you book your BOUNCE session online at bounceinc.com.au. The entire booking cost will be added to your Afterpay order. For more information on the afterpay process, visit https://help.afterpay.com/hc/en-au . What part of my party does the Afterpay payment apply to? If you have chosen to pay via Afterpay for your initial deposit payment, please be aware that this is only for your $150 deposit, not your full party payment. Final payment is required 7 days before your party date and will be a separate Afterpay transaction if you wish to pay via Afterpay. Alternatively, your final party payment can be made in full via credit card prior to your party. Before You Arrive What time should i arrive for my booking? For General Admission bookings, we recommend arriving 15 min prior to allow time for parking and checking in. If you’ve got a party booked with us, this time is built in to the party structure, so there’s no need to arrive much earlier than your start time! Please make sure to check your closest venue for opening times. What’s the parking situation? On-site parking is available but limited in peak times. We recommend you carpool with your mates for pre-BOUNCE fun. BOUNCE Freestyle Academy How do I enrol into the BOUNCE Freestyle Academy or Holiday Camp? All Freestyle Academy enrolments are made through BOUNCE memberships. You can sign up for a membership here. Do I need to re-enrol into my class for next term? Classes can be booked in for a whole term through our membership portal. These classes will not automatically roll over to next term, so please make sure your enrollments are up to date! Are there waiting lists for classes? Unfortunately not. If the class you’re after is booked out, the best thing you can do is keep checking back on the booking page to see if a spot becomes available. Do BOUNCE Freestyle Academy classes run over the school holidays? Our Freestyle Academy classes only run during the school Term. If you’re interested in classes over the School Holidays, check out our Holiday Camps! Do classes run on public holidays? Classes do not run on Public Holidays, but you are welcome to use the free venue access included in your membership to visit BOUNCE all through the school holidays. Remember, we always recommend booking in advance! Will I be charged for school holidays, even if there are no classes? Yes you will still be charged the $25 a week membership fee over the school holidays. With your membership, you are entitled to 1 free Holiday Camp booking per week of the school holiday, and you are also welcome to use your free venue access through the school holidays as well. If you are not planning on using your membership over the school holidays, you can pause your membership through the membership portal on our website or by emailing [email protected] . What happens if I’m going to miss a class? If you are going to miss your class, you can reschedule your class up to 4 hours before your class is due to take place via our membership portal or by calling through to our friendly contact centre team. If you cannot attend your class and do not reschedule, we do not offer make up classes or credits for this. During Your Visit What do i wear? We recommend athletic clothing with some stretch. Baggy jeans are fine or tracksuit pants and long sleeve shirts are recommended. BOUNCE socks with grip are compulsory to avoid slipping. These are added to your admission fee the first time you visit BOUNCE and are then yours to keep to be used again at all subsequent visits. Lace-up, flat-soled and closed toe sports/skate shoes must be worn in X-Park and Wall Climb at select venues. Why do i need to purchase the BOUNCE grip socks? In accordance with Australia Trampoline Parks Association (ATPA) guidelines, trampoline grip socks must be worn on the trampolines at all times. This is a safety requirement and strictly enforced at our venues, therefore regular socks are not acceptable. Our BOUNCE socks have been tested for our trampolines, and as we cannot guarantee the same level of quality in alternative socks, we do not allow other brands to be worn. Once purchased, they are yours to keep to be used again at all subsequent visits. Can i bring my own food? Due to our food health & safety policy, no self-catering is allowed, including cakes. You are however welcome to bring your own water. Visitors who have made a birthday party booking are allowed to bring in their own birthday cake for an $8 once-off fee, to be contained in their private party room. Do you have lockers? BOUNCE has open cube lockers and paid secure lockers available at select venues. If you’d like to find out about paid secure locker availability at your venue, you can give us a ring on the following numbers: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 Is there cooling in the venues? While some BOUNCE venues have air conditioning, all venues are equipped with cooling. Please keep in mind, during hotter months and at full capacity, our venues can feel quite warm. All BOUNCE venues have drink taps available with the cafe serving cold drinks all day to cool off. Are there change tables? Yes! Every BOUNCE venue has change tables available for use. Is Wall Climb included in my ticket? Yes, every BOUNCE ticket provides access to all features at your chosen venue. What is the cost of BOUNCE socks? BOUNCE socks are $3.50 per pair. Frequently Asked Questions About BOUNCE Memberships What are BOUNCE Memberships? We’re excited to share our new value-packed benefits program which offers you BOUNCE entry, access to our Freestyle Academy coaching program plus more awesome extras. Take your love of BOUNCE to the next level and join as a member to unlock all the benefits. Can I pause my membership if I go on holidays? Yes, you can. You are able to pause your membership up to 4 times per year, for between 1 – 3 weeks at a time. If you’re a current member and you would like to pause your membership, please email us at [email protected] at least one week before you’d like to pause. How do I cancel a membership? If you’d like to cancel an active membership, please fill in this form. General Information What do i wear? We recommend athletic clothing with some stretch. Baggy jeans are fine or tracksuit pants and long sleeve shirts are recommended. BOUNCE socks with grip are compulsory to avoid slipping. These are added to your admission fee the first time you visit BOUNCE and are then yours to keep to be used again at all subsequent visits. Lace-up, flat-soled and closed toe sports/skate shoes must be worn in X-Park and Wall Climb at select venues. Where is BOUNCE located? We currently have an ever increasing number of venues in Australia, as well as international. Check out our locations page for your closest venue and opening hours. What if i have questions and want to talk to someone? Give us a call on the relevant number to speak to a BOUNCE customer service team member: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 How do i find out more info? You can call our Contact Centre crew between 9:00am – 6:00pm Monday – Saturday AEST and 9:00am – 5:00pm Sunday AEST on the following numbers: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 Alternatively, you can reach out via our Contact Us form, and we’ll respond to you via email. What do I do if I’m running late? If you’re running late, you are still able to attend your BOUNCE session and you can start bouncing as soon as you arrive and check in at reception. Unfortunately, we are unable to extend your jump after your session, so you will still need to exit the trampolines at your scheduled finish time. If you would like to change your booking that is within the next 2 hours, please give our team a call to amend as you will not be able to do this online. What do i do if i’ve lost something at BOUNCE? If you’ve lost or left behind something at BOUNCE, click here to fill out our lost property form. If your matter is urgent, please visit your local BOUNCE for immediate assistance. What is the cost of BOUNCE socks? BOUNCE socks are $3.50 per pair. Group Events What is the best value ticket option for groups above 4? We suggest the Awesome 4Some ticket for groups of 4. Any numbers beyond this can be purchased as single tickets or multiple Awesome 4Some tickets. If you prefer a 2 hour session, the 2 Hour Superpass is recommended. How long are Group sessions? You have the option of a 1, 1.5 or 2 hour session. Check out our Group Events page for more info! How is a Group Experience structured? Our Group Events offer the option of either a 1 Hour, 1.5 Hour, or 2 Hour session, and comes in the form of an Unhosted Experience that allows jumpers the freedom to explore the venue at their own leisure, or our premium Hosted Experience that includes your own dedicated BOUNCEinc Hosts to facilitate an experience you’re not going to forget! For our Hosted experience, regardless of how long you book for, only the first hour will be hosted, with any extra time added on being Unhosted. What is the minimum number of participants for a Group experience? The minimum requirement for our Group Experiences is 10 participants. What is the maximum number of participants for a Group experience? For an Unhosted group, our maximum number is the venue capacity for the venue you are wanting to book for. For a hosted group, we operate off a 1:22 ratio for our BOUNCE hosts, so if you are planning on bringing more that 44 attendees for your hosted session, please send an enquiry or give our friendly contact centre a call to see if we will have the staff available. Is a Group booking a good alternative to a party booking? YES! Group Experiences are basically a party without the food included. Please note that you do not get access to a party room and BYO cakes are not permitted. What is a full venue hire? Full Venue Hire provides a group with exclusive access during a designated time slot. Unlike our School & Team Event Group Experiences with a fixed cost, Full Venue Hire has no set price. Instead, we offer customers a custom quote tailored to their specific needs and requirements for the event. If you’d like to speak to our Full Venue Hire team, please visit our Full Venue Hire page . Does BOUNCE allow external entertainment? No, BOUNCE does not permit any external entertainment for any bookings. Homebush Venue FAQs Where should i park at BOUNCE homebush? Please enter the Homebush Logistics Centre via the Welfare Street Entrance. For weekdays, BOUNCE has allocated parking out the front of the venue (please review signage), otherwise during weekends you can park anywhere out the front of the building. Additional parking is available on the side of the venue. miniBOUNCE Do i need to book in advance? We recommended booking in advance to ensure you can visit miniBOUNCE when you want. Weekends and holidays sell out in advance and walk-ins cannot be accommodated if we are sold out. Click Book Now to check availability and make a session booking. Can i bring a child that is over 6 years old? miniBOUNCE has been specially designed for kids aged 6 and below, and it would be unsafe for older children to play on the equipment. They are more than welcome to stay in the cafe with you, but cannot go into the play area. Where is miniBOUNCE located? We currently have two miniBOUNCE venues. Please select your preferred venue below to find more info. miniBOUNCE Carindale . miniBOUNCE Ipswich . I don’t have a credit card. Can I pay when I get there? Please note that miniBOUNCE is a cashless venue. Online, we accept all major credit cards and debit cards. You can also pay with EFTPOS at the venue. Is my booking refundable or transferrable? All bookings are non-refundable and non-transferrable. If you have further concerns about this please contact us on (07) 3569 0705 or email [email protected] What is the size and age limit? miniBOUNCE is designed for children up to 6 years old. Children under 12 months do not require a ticket, but will only be permitted in the Toddler area. What time should i arrive for my booking? We recommend arriving 15 min prior to booked time to check in. What if i have questions and want to talk to someone? Give us a call on (07) 3569 0705 to speak to a BOUNCE customer service team member. What type of ticket should I buy? We offer various types of tickets to suit different customers at our miniBOUNCE venue. Check out our pricing information here . What do i wear & are there change rooms available? We recommend athletic clothing with some stretch. Tracksuit pants and long sleeve shirts are recommended. miniBOUNCE socks with grip are compulsory to avoid slipping. These can be purchased when you book a ticket and they are reusable. Please contact us on (07) 3569 0705 to find out about change room availability at your chosen venue. Can i bring my own food? We have a café located in our miniBOUNCE venue and have a range of delicious snacks and lunch options available. Please note that external food is not permitted, including cakes. Visitors who have made a birthday party booking are allowed to bring in their own birthday cake for an $8 once-off fee, to be contained in their private party room. Do you have lockers? No, we do not have lockers. Pigeon holes are available at miniBOUNCE for storage if needed. Do you have baby change rooms? Yes, we do. There are baby change tables available, these are located in the bathroom. Do you sell gift vouchers? Yes – it’s MUCH cheaper with a Multi Visit Pass. Our passes come in 3, 5 & 10 sessions and are available online or in venue. Is miniBOUNCE safe? Safety is the number one priority at miniBOUNCE. For details see our Health and Safety section below. How do i find out more info? Please call our contact centre crew on (07) 3569 0705 during the following hours: 9:00am – 7:00pm Monday – Sunday AEST Alternatively send us an email to [email protected] Where should i park? miniBOUNCE is located in Westfield Carindale – 1151 Creek Rd, Shop MM11A, Carindale QLD 4152. When you arrive at Westfield, the best parking is via Carindale Street Southbound, after the bus interchange and go to Orange L3. Parties Are venues able to print out invites? Yes they can, however please note that they are printed on normal paper and are not hard copy. What do I do if something happens and I can’t attend my party? You will need to contact us as soon as possible, if this is within 2 weeks of the party date. Any changes are subject to availability and venue approval and may incur a rescheduling or cancellation fee. Does the venue have a coffee tab option available? When you book a party, there is an option to buy coffee cards. 1 coffee card includes 5 regular sized coffees. If this isn’t suitable, there is an option to open a coffee tab instead. You can discuss this with your party leader/ host on the day of your booking. What does a party look like if the kids are different ages? The party arrangements may vary based on the booking made, but we suggest selecting the party package that suits the birthday child and/or the majority age of the guests. Older or younger guests are welcome to be included in the party numbers, but they might need to participate separately from the main party group during some of the session, depending on height restrictions. Can I have extra guests in the party room who aren’t booked? I.e. adults Certainly! You are allowed to bring a parent with you. However, depending on the room that has been booked, it is recommended to have one parent per child to ensure everyone can fit comfortably. Can I drop off my cake before my party? While this is a possibility, we advise you to contact us in advance so that we can verify whether or not the venue has space available at that time. While some venues do have sufficient capacity, others may have limited fridge space. Can i bring balloons or decorations to my party? If you have a party booked with us, you are more than welcome to bring along balloons or decorations. We just ask that you don’t stick anything to the walls, or bring something that could be messy. Keep in mind that you will only have access to your party room for 40 minutes, so if you’re bringing decorations, we recommend that they don’t take too long for you to set up. Can i bring a cake if i haven’t booked a party? Customers are not permitted to bring a cake unless they have a party room, or hired a room for private use, due to health and safety reasons. If i have less than 10 party guests, do i still need to pay for 10? Yes, even if there are less than 10 guests bouncing, the minimum payment for 10 still needs to be made. Can i bring my own cake decorations/candles for the ice cream cake that i purchased for my party? Yes, you can bring your own decorations or candles, however, we can provide them free of charge if you don’t! If i’ve purchased an ice-cream cake for my party and want to bring one of my own as well, do i need to pay the byo cake fee? No – if you’ve purchased an ice cream cake from us and want to bring your own, you do not need to pay the additional BYO cake fee. Can i bring more than one cake for my party? If you’ve paid the $8 BYO cake fee, it’s just a once-off! You can bring more than one cake. Are the gluten free options for parties suitable for people with Coeliac disease? Whilst we try our absolute best to prevent cross-contamination, our gluten free options cannot be guaranteed coeliac-friendly. Safety What is the size and age limit? One of the great things about trampolining is that anyone can do it, from young children to their parents and even grandparents. There are no age restrictions, but in order to ensure the safety of everyone, there are various height limits in our venues. miniBOUNCERs must be able to walk unassisted and must be under 110cms. To see the restrictions in the venue you are planning on visiting, check out our locations page. Do i need to accompany my child while jumping? Children 12 years and under must be supervised by a parent/guardian at all times whilst visiting BOUNCE. A parent/guardian must be over the age of 16. Supervising guests do not need to pay entry, they are welcome to watch and spectate for free, however, any visitor who is actively using equipment will be required to pay entry. For children who require closer supervision, we recommend purchasing a ticket so that you can join them. Is jumping at bounce good for me? Yes. Trampolining is one of the best form of exercise there is! Click here to read up on health benefits of trampolining. Is BOUNCE safe? Safety is our number one priority at BOUNCE. For more details, check out our safety section . Is there a weight limit on the trampolines? The recommended maximum weight limit for our trampolines, based on supplier specifications, ranges between 120-140kg depending on the venue. If this may affect you, please contact us so we can clarify. Can i jump with a cast/splint/moon boot? No – Unfortunately it’s unsafe to bounce with a cast, splint or moon boot. If you’re coming to a party with one, get in touch with our Contact Centre team to see how else you might be able to participate. Can i bounce if i’m pregnant? No – Unfortunately it’s unsafe to bounce if you are pregnant. What are the most important safety rules? Our three core safety rules are: One person per trampoline Jump within your skill level Don’t jump or land on the padding What age does a person have to be to supervise a child? To supervise a child, you must be 16 years or older. We suggest bringing ID for anyone who looks under the age of 25 so that we can identify the supervisor’s age. At what age can a person attend BOUNCE without adult supervision? Anyone 12 years olds or older can come in for a BOUNCE session without a adult/parent/guardian. For anyone under 12 years old, we require a parent/guardian over the age of 16 to supervise. Tickets and Bookings Do i need to book in advance? We recommended booking in advance to ensure you can jump when you want. Weekends and holidays sell out in advance and walk-ins cannot be accommodated if we are sold out. Click Book Now to check availability and make a session booking. What type of ticket should i buy? Check out our pricing page for a full list of ticket types, and to find out which is right for you! Do i need a ticket if i’m only spectating? For BOUNCE venues, spectators do not need to purchase a ticket if they are not bouncing or actively using the equipment. You can accompany your child across the activities, but if you wish to join in with them, then you will require a ticket. For miniBOUNCE Carindale, spectator rules apply. 1 pass allows for 2 spectators during peak periods. Is my booking refundable or transferrable? All payments are non refundable & non-transferable, excepting permitted changes made online up to 2 hours prior. For parties, these changes must be made more than 7 days prior. If you would like to edit your booking, please click here . If you have any further questions, please contact us . The website says it’s booked out, are there still spaces available? Unfortunately not. Once a session has been fully booked out on the website there are no spaces left in the venue. We highly recommend pre-booking your ticket ahead of time to secure a space in venue especially on weekends and school holidays. I don’t have a credit card. Can i pay when i get there? We accept all major credit cards and debit cards, so it’s easy to book in advance. If you are unable to book online then you can make a booking over the counter however by not booking in advance you run the risk of missing out or waiting for a session with available space. Can i edit my booking? You can edit your booking by accessing your BOUNCE account on our website or app! Click here to edit your booking. How do i redeem a voucher? Add your selected tickets to your cart, and when you get to the checkout screen you will be able to apply your promo code in the prompt, where it will automatically apply for you. Only one promo code can be applied per booking. If you have a Latitude gift card, these can also be applied at the checkout screen. Supaworld gift cards and vouchers can be used to make a booking over the phone, or they can be used in venue. Unfortunately they can no longer be used to book online. I have a companion/carer card, do i need to book? Carers and/or support workers can jump for free with no prior booking upon presentation of a valid Carer or Companion Card. As always, we recommend the individual you are attending with books their ticket in advance to secure a spot. Do you offer group rates? Yes – Awesome 4some tickets mean you can jump as a group of four and save. For groups of 10 or more, click here for discounted prices, or here if you’re a school group! Do you sell gift vouchers? Yes – it’s MUCH cheaper with a Multi Visit Pass. Our 3, 5 & 10 Multi Visit Passes are available online or in venue for General Admission, miniBOUNCERS and Student Sessions. Click here to see more! You can also give the gift of an awesome, active experience with 1, 3, or 10 visit Gift of Flights. With a Multi Visit Pass, BOUNCE socks and a wristband included, it’s the perfect ready-to-go present everyone will love! Available to purchase online or in venue. Click here to see more! What do I do if I’m running late? If you’re running late, you are still able to attend your BOUNCE session and you can start bouncing as soon as you arrive and check in at reception. Unfortunately, we are unable to extend your jump after your session, so you will still need to exit the trampolines at your scheduled finish time. If you would like to change your booking that is within the next 2 hours, please give our team a call to amend as you will not be able to do this online. Can I purchase a Gift of Flight in the venue? Gift Of Flight passes are available for purchase at venues, subject to stock availability. Seasonal GOF packs like Christmas packs are only available in venues for a limited time. If the venue doesn’t have them in stock, you have the option to buy either a digital or physical copy online What is the best value ticket option for groups above 4? We suggest the Awesome 4Some ticket for groups of 4. Any numbers beyond this can be purchased as single tickets or multiple Awesome 4Some tickets. If you prefer a 2 hour session, the 2 Hour Superpass is recommended. What is the best value ticket option for groups above 4? We suggest the Awesome 4Some ticket for groups of 4. Any numbers beyond this can be purchased as single tickets or multiple Awesome 4Some tickets. If you prefer a 2 hour session, the 2 Hour Superpass is recommended. What are the food options for Friday Super Session + Meal ticket? All venues offer Pizza + Drink as part of the Friday Super Sessions. I booked the incorrect venue – how do I change the venue? Unfortunately, you’re unable to change your venue online. If you need to change your venue, get in touch with our team via the Contact Us page. What is the cost of BOUNCE socks? BOUNCE socks are $3.50 per pair. All FAQS Do i need to accompany my child while jumping? Children 12 years and under must be supervised by a parent/guardian at all times whilst visiting BOUNCE. A parent/guardian must be over the age of 16. Supervising guests do not need to pay entry, they are welcome to watch and spectate for free, however, any visitor who is actively using equipment will be required to pay entry. For children who require closer supervision, we recommend purchasing a ticket so that you can join them. What time should i arrive for my booking? For General Admission bookings, we recommend arriving 15 min prior to allow time for parking and checking in. If you’ve got a party booked with us, this time is built in to the party structure, so there’s no need to arrive much earlier than your start time! Please make sure to check your closest venue for opening times. What is the parking situation? On-site parking is available but limited in peak times. We recommend you carpool with your mates for pre-BOUNCE fun. Are there change tables? Yes! Every BOUNCE venue has change tables available for use. What do i wear? We recommend athletic clothing with some stretch. Baggy jeans are fine or tracksuit pants and long sleeve shirts are recommended. BOUNCE socks with grip are compulsory to avoid slipping. These will need to be purchased the first time you visit BOUNCE and are then yours to keep to be used again at all subsequent visits. Lace-up, flat-soled and closed toe sports/skate shoes must be worn in X-Park and Wall Climb at select venues. If you’d like to find out about change room availability at your venue, you can give us a ring on the following numbers: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 Why do i need to purchase the BOUNCE grip socks? In accordance with Australia Trampoline Parks Association (ATPA) guidelines, trampoline grip socks must be worn on the trampolines at all times. This is a safety requirement and strictly enforced at our venues, therefore regular socks are not acceptable. Our BOUNCE socks have been tested for our trampolines, and as we cannot guarantee the same level of quality in alternative socks, we do not allow other brands to be worn. Once purchased, they are yours to keep to be used again at all subsequent visits. What is the cost of BOUNCE socks? BOUNCE socks are $3.50 per pair. Is Wall Climb included in my ticket? Wall Climb is available at select BOUNCE venues, see here. If your local BOUNCE has a Wall Climb arena, your BOUNCE ticket includes access to this feature. Do you have lockers? BOUNCE has open cube lockers and paid secure lockers available at select venues. If you’d like to find out about paid secure locker availability at your venue, you can give us a ring on the following numbers: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 Can I purchase a Gift of Flight in the venue? Gift Of Flight passes are available for purchase at venues, subject to stock availability. Seasonal Gift Of Flight packs such as Christmas packs are only available in venues for a limited time. If the venue doesn’t have them in stock, you have the option to buy either a digital or physical copy online. Can i bring my own food? BOUNCE does not allow external catering or entertainment. BYO birthday cakes are available for birthday party bookings and incur a one off fee. For guests with allergies and dietary requirements, you may bring food if we are unable to offer an alternative, however heating facilities are not available. Does the venue have a coffee tab option available? When you book a party, there is an option to buy coffee cards. 1 coffee card includes 5 regular sized coffees. If this isn’t suitable, there is an option to open a coffee tab instead. You can discuss this with your party leader/ host on the day of your booking. Where is BOUNCE located? We currently have an ever increasing number of venues in Australia, as well as international. Check out our locations tab at the top of your screen for your closest venue and opening hours. What if i have questions and want to talk to someone? Give us a call on the relevant number to speak to a BOUNCE customer service team member: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645. How do i find out more info? You can call our Contact Centre crew between 9:00am – 6:00pm Monday – Saturday AEST and 9:00am – 5:00pm Sunday AEST on the following numbers: Victoria or Tasmania (03) 9131 5099 Queensland (07) 3569 0704 Adelaide or Western Australia (08) 6183 7645 Alternatively, you can reach out via our Contact Us form, and we’ll respond to you via email. What are the most important safety rules? Our three core safety rules are: One person per trampoline Jump within your skill level Don’t jump or land on the padding. Do i need to book in advance? We recommended booking in advance to ensure you can jump when you want. Weekends and holidays sell out in advance and walk-ins cannot be accommodated if we are sold out. Click Book Now to check availability and make a session booking. The website says it’s booked out, are there still spaces available? Unfortunately not. Once a session has been fully booked out on the website there are no spaces left in the venue. We highly recommend pre-booking your ticket ahead of time to secure a space in venue especially on weekends and school holidays. I booked the incorrect venue – how do I change the venue? Unfortunately, you’re unable to change your venue online. If you need to change your venue, get in touch with our team via the Contact Us page. What do i do if i’ve lost something at BOUNCE? If you’ve lost of left behind something at BOUNCE, click here to fill out our lost property form If your matter is urgent, please visit your local BOUNCE for immediate assistance. What do I do if something happens and I can’t attend my party? Please contact us as soon as possible if you need to change your party 2 weeks within the party date. Any changes are subject to availability and venue approval. Are venues able to print out invites? Yes they can, however please note that they are printed on normal paper and are not hard copy. Can i bring a cake if i haven’t booked a party? Customers are not permitted to bring a cake unless they have a party room, or hired a room for private use, due to health and safety reasons. Can I drop off my cake before my party? While this is a possibility, we advise you to contact us in advance so that we can verify whether or not the venue has space available at that time. While some venues do have sufficient capacity, others may have limited fridge space. Are the gluten free options for parties suitable for people with Coeliac disease? Whilst we try our absolute best to prevent cross-contamination, our gluten free options cannot be guaranteed coeliac-friendly. If i have less than 10 party guests, do i still need to pay for 10? Yes, even if there are less than 10 kids bouncing, the minimum payment of 10 still needs to be made. Can I bring balloons or decorations to my party? If you have a party booked with us, you are more than welcome to bring along balloons or decorations. We just ask that you don’t stick anything to the walls, or bring something that could be messy. Keep in mind that you will only have access to your party room for 40 minutes, so if you’re bringing decorations, we recommend that they don’t take too long for you to set up. Can i bring my own cake decorations/candles for the ice cream cake that i purchased for my party? Yes, you can bring your own decorations or candles, however, we can provide them free of charge if you don’t! Do i need to pay a BYO cake fee when they have purchased an ice cream cake? No – if you’ve purchased an ice cream cake from us and want to bring your own, you do not need to pay the additional BYO cake fee. Can I have extra guests in the party room who aren’t booked? Certainly! You are allowed to bring a parent with you. However, depending on the room that has been booked, it is recommended to have one parent per child to ensure everyone can fit comfortably. What does a party look like if the kids are different ages? The party arrangements may vary based on the booking made, but we suggest selecting the party package that suits the birthday child and/or the majority age of the guests. Older or younger guests are welcome to be included in the party numbers, but they might need to participate separately from the main party group during some of the session, depending on height restrictions. At what age can a person attend BOUNCE without adult supervision? Anyone 12 years olds or older can come in for a BOUNCE session without a adult/parent/guardian. For anyone under 12 years old, we require a parent/guardian over the age of 16 to supervise. Is BOUNCE safe? Safety is our number one priority at BOUNCE. For more details, check out our safety section. Can i jump with a cast/splint/moon boot No – Unfortunately it’s unsafe to bounce with a cast, splint or moon boot. If you’re coming to a party with one, get in touch with our Contact Centre team to see how else you might be able to participate. Can i BOUNCE if i’m pregnant? No – Unfortunately it’s unsafe to bounce if you are pregnant. Can I edit my booking? You can edit your booking by accessing your BOUNCE account on our website! Click here to edit your booking. I have a companion/carer card, do i need to book? Carers and/or support workers can jump for free with no prior booking upon presentation of a valid Carer or Companion Card. As always, we recommend the individual you are attending with books their ticket in advance to secure a spot. Do i need a ticket if i’m only spectating? No, spectators do not need to purchase a ticket if they are not bouncing or actively using the equipment. You can accompany your child across the activities, but if you wish to join in with them, then you will require a ticket. Is my booking refundable or transferrable? All payments are non refundable & non-transferable, excepting permitted changes made online up to 2 hours prior. For parties, these changes must be made more than 7 days prior. If you would like to edit your booking, please click here . If you have any further questions, please contact us. Do you sell gift vouchers? Yes – it’s MUCH cheaper with a Multi Visit Pass. Our 3, 5 & 10 Multi Visit Passes are available online or in venue for General Admission, miniBOUNCERS and Student Sessions. Click here to see more! How do i redeem a voucher? Add your selected tickets to your cart, and when you get to the checkout screen you will be able to apply your promo code in the prompt, where it will automatically apply for you. Only one promo code can be applied per booking. What type of ticket should i buy? Check out our pricing page for a full list of ticket types, and to find out which is right for you! Do you offer group rates? Yes – Awesome 4some tickets mean you can jump as a group of four and save. For groups of 10 or more, click here for discounted prices, or here if you’re a school group! I don’t have a credit card. Can i pay when i get there? We accept all major credit cards and debit cards, so it’s easy to book in advance. If you are unable to book online then you can make a booking over the counter however by not booking in advance you run the risk of missing out or waiting for a session with available space. How do I enrol into the BOUNCE Freestyle Academy or Holiday Camp? All Freestyle Academy enrolments are made through our website via this link. Do I need to re-enrol into my class for next term? If you are already enrolled in the Freestyle Academy, your enrolment will automatically carry over from Term to Term. If you would like to cancel your enrolment, please fill out our cancellation request form. Are there waiting lists for classes? Unfortunately not. If the class you’re after is booked out, the best thing you can do is keep checking back on the booking page to see if a spot becomes available. Do BOUNCE Freestyle Academy classes run over the school holidays? Our Freestyle Academy classes only run during the school Term. If you’re interested in classes over the School Holidays, check out our Holiday Camps! Do classes run on public holidays? Classes do not run on public holidays, and Cadet Passes can not be used on these days either. Will I be charged for public holidays, even if there are no classes? No, you will not be charged for any classes that fall on a public holiday. How do I cancel my enrolment? You are able to cancel your enrolment after they have met our minimum term contract of 6 weeks. If you meet this criteria, you can fill out our cancellation request form and a team member will be in touch.BOUNCE socks are $3.50 per pair. What happens if I’m going to miss a class? Please fill out a missed class pass form before the date of your class, and we will organise for a free General Admission pass to be assigned to your BOUNCE account. Each participant is eligible for two missed class passes per Term. What is the best value ticket option for groups above 4? We suggest the Awesome 4Some ticket for groups of 4. Any numbers beyond this can be purchased as single tickets or multiple Awesome 4Some tickets. If you prefer a 2 hour session, the 2 Hour Superpass is recommended. How long are Group sessions? You have the option of a 1.5 or 2.5 hour session. Check out our Group Events page for more info! How is a Group Experience structured? Our Group sessions include a 15-minute pre-bounce activity where the host hands out socks/wristbands, gives a safety briefing, and leads a warm-up game. The first hour is a hosted session, followed by an unhosted session during the second hour (for 2.5-hour experiences). The event concludes with a 15-minute post-bounce activity, where prizes and awards are distributed to select participants. Note that sessions start on the hour, but group bookings begin at the quarter to mark (e.g., 1:45 PM) and finish a quarter past the hour. What is the minimum number of participants for a Group experience? The minimum requirement for our Group Experiences is 10 participants. What is the maximum number of participants for a Group experience? The maximum number of participants that can be hosted at 1 time is 66 jumpers, but there is room to expand this number with restructuring the group. For more information, please contact our groups team. Is a Group booking a good alternative to a party booking? YES! Group Experiences are basically a party without the food included. What is the minimum number of participants for a Group experience? Full Venue Hire provides a group with exclusive access during a designated time slot. Unlike our School & Team Event Group Experiences with a fixed cost, Full Venue Hire has no set price. Instead, we offer customers a custom quote tailored to their specific needs and requirements for the event. If you’d like to speak to our Full Venue Hire team, please visit our Full Venue Hire page. What are the food options for Friday Super Session + Meal ticket? Food options for Friday Super session meals depend on the venue: Heidelberg, Joondalup and Greenacres offer a burger + drink. All other venue offer pizza + drink. © 2025. All rights reverved. Security Notice – 21 Aug 2025 Some visitors to our website on 21/08/2025 between 1:59pm–3:30pm AEST may have seen a fake “verify you are human” prompt on our homepage. This was not from BOUNCE. Clicking it could have downloaded malicious software on Windows devices. If you did not download/run a file → there is no action needed. If you were not on a Windows device (e.g. iPhone) you are not impacted. If you did → run a full antivirus scan, remove flagged files, and update your system. If you did download and run this file, please contact our contact centre team to verify this and for further instructions. No customer data was accessed or compromised. The issue has been fixed and the site is safe to use. If you have questions or need further guidance, please contact us. Our contact centre is open Monday – Saturday from 9am – 6pm AEST and Sunday from 9am – 5pm AEST. Outside of these hours, please email [email protected] (03) 9131 5099 – VIC & TAS (07) 3569 0704 – QLD (08) 6183 7645 – SA & WA (02) 9052 2111 – NSW (02) 6189 2391 – ACT × Scroll to Top Main Menu About Freestyle BOUNCE Rewards Frequently Asked Questions Contact Us Hosts Features Parties Ultimate Parties miniBOUNCE Parties Unhosted Parties Get Ready For Your Party Groups Group Events School Sessions Full Venue Hire Tickets & Prices Prices Offers & Promotions End of Term Party Gift Vouchers & Multi Visit Passes Classes & Memberships BOUNCE Memberships miniBOUNCE Squad Memberships How To Book Memberships BOUNCE Freestyle Academy miniBOUNCE Squad BOUNCE  Squad Flight Squad Ninja Squad Holiday Camp Careers About Main Menu Freestyle Bounce Rewards Frequently Asked Questions Contact Us Hosts Parties Main Menu Ultimate Parties miniBOUNCE Parties Unhosted Party Get Ready for your party Programs & Groups Main Menu Group Events School Sessions Full Venue Hire BOUNCE Freestyle Academy BFA miniBOUNCE Squad BFA BOUNCE  Squad BFA Ninja Squad BFA Flight Squad Holiday Camp Tickets & Prices Main Menu Prices Offers and Promotions After Dark Gift Vouchers and Multi Visit Passes Memberships Main Menu Memberships - MiniBounce How to book memberships School Holidays Search Login/ My Account
